body.p:
Hodgenville Larue County Ky Sept 30th 1863
Tho E Bramlette E. Govr of Ky
Dear Sir

The undersigned would Respectfully State, that in May last an Elected Justices of the Peace &c for this county, and in this the first District James A Middleton & Wm H Hamilton were Elected & Commissioned. We have no knowledge of Hamilton ever having qualified. Middleton having done so: but he has volunteered & is now a captan in the 27th Ky Vol. under Col Spalding. and our District is left without any Justice of the peace in it, which is very inconvienent to the community. In view of the promises we would recommened Samuel Allen as suitable person to fill the vacancy, he having Served in that capacity for ten years or more. Under the circumstances if you will appoint Mr Allen it will confer a great favor on the citizens & the undersigned

Very Respectfully yours-
E. R. Burba Clk. L. C. C.
Saml Wilson
J. H. Rodman
Jas W Rogers
B. F. Burba. P M
Larue Co.
J. P.
1863
